Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S4000 14 MP review
Reviews.Author: tech3
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix S4000 14 MP Digital Camera with Fujinon 30x Super Wide Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCDI have owned a DSLR camera for sometime (Canon Rebel T1i) and wanted something I can take to places like the beach without hauling around the lenses, tripods, and the worry of damage to a $1000 camera. I want a fun, have a camera ready on the fly type of scenario...Yes, its not a DSLR CANON or a NIKON or you would have bought one. So dont expect the same here. You get what you pay for and remind you this is ONLY a $230.00 camera...NOT A $1100 Canon with all the bells and whistles.I have read many terrible reviews for this Fujiflm camera. But for me, I LOVE this camera for the PRICE and for just GENERAL USE - not pro use...its great for being with the family and not concerned about shutter speed...Its a great "family" camera. The picture quality of the camera great. Outdoors and Indoors. The zoom 30x is incredible, and VERY STABLE at 30x too..WHILE HOLDING IT! Very clear shots and you cant do that with a Canon unless you are on a tripod. The HD video is great too.The Panorama setting is very cool. I love the wide angle screen shot. Video is great. Only thing I have found so far that is not to my liking is if you leave the lens cap on, the camera will tell you there is a problem and forces you to turn off the camera and on again. You just cant take the lens off and go. You have to shut it down. Not a big deal but annoying.Picture quality is beautiful I think. For a simple point and shoot with HD Video and Panoramic viewing PLUS a 30X zoom...its AWESOME! MY Canon will not allow zooming in ideo mode where this camera will. You can ZOOM in and out while taking great video and the sound is great too.Just a few drawbacks I can mention are:There are some modes the camera has where the colors look "different", but still CLEAR and FOCUSED, which I care about more. The intensity and shading seems "off" a little, but so what? ITs FUN in the SUN and most people want to see their little girl in the pool with Grandma, or their son running the bases at the baseball game. (zoomed in too!)One other drawback is the PLASTIC. 80% of it is plastic so dont drop it. Or that will be the end of it. I have not done that yet, but fair warning just the same. Another drawback is where they placed the slot for the memory card, which is in the battery compartmant. Why didnt they leave an open slot somewhere else on the side rather than there? So you have to remove the battery lid to get to the card which I really dont like at all.At any rate, the pluses are the 30x zoom, decent pics indoor and outdoor, panaoramic mode, HD video, and is HDMI compatible.Better than a point and shoot and FAR less than a DSLR. I put this camera in the "Very Good for the money camera category UNDER $250.Hope this helps!!Lee

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm S4000
Reviews.Author: hiker28
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  I purchased this camera to replace an older model high-end point and shoot.  It has a 30X zoom lens that allows you to get photos from a distance that are sharp and clear.  I consider myself decent amateur photographer.  I hike a lot and take the camera with me all the time.  Landscapes and wildlife are my most common types of photos.  On my first outing with the camera, I was able to get a photo of a bald eagle that was at least 1000 feet away.  I especially like how much feedback the camera gives you while focusing.  It will tell you if the focus isn't correct, if the picture will be blurry, if someone blinked, and a lot more.  If you're used to using pocket point and shoot cameras, this will be an easy transition.  Two features I especially like are the electronic viewfinder and the use of AA batteries for power.  Using the setting for high resolution photos, I still get 300+ photos from one charging of the NiMh batteries.  While this camera doesn't have the range of adjustability of an DSLR, it takes photos that look just as good.  My only disappointment is the camera software.  It isn't nearly as sophisticated as the camera.  My old Olympus camera software is about 5 years old and is far superior.  Fortunately, there's lots of photo software out there to use.  I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice but slow indoors
Reviews.Author: Razz
Reviews.Content: My critique is based on comparing the Fujifilm S400A to the Fujifilm HS10. All comparisons are also based on setting both cameras to Automatic mode. First let me say that both cameras take great outdoor pictures. Indoors is another matter. The S4000 is a lot slower then the HS10 in focusing and exposure settings. I also do not like the indoor auto white balance on the S4000, even with forced flash. The S4000 indoor pictures look yellowish. With the HS10, the flash is dominant and the pictures are more vibrant in my opinion. The resolution on both cameras is good (when the pictures are in focus).  The HS10 has much better and faster focusing.  The S4000 is not nearly as good. With the S4000 you have to take it slow when taking indoor pictures in order to get a focused picture. The motorized zoom on the S4000 is better then the HS10's lens for shooting video. The manual zoom on the HS10 will shake the camera when zooming so your video will look jerky. The S4000 zoom motor noise will be heard in the video unfortunately, but only slightly. The amazing plus for both cameras is when zooming in to the max and being able to hand hold the camera and get a perfect shake free picture. I took the HS10 to Hawaii and shot a light house at full zoom while sanding on a small boat. I got a great detailed picture.  I have also shot full zoomed in pictures with the S4000 and got great results. I am disappointed that the S4000 does not have a hot shoe or threads on the lens for a filter, whereas the HS10 has both.  Physically the S4000 smaller and much lighter then the HS10. For Video, the S4000 has a better video format, Motion Jpeg which is more compatible with editing software. The the HS10 has the terrible MOV format that I hate. I am sure I have not covered everything, I am a Nikon camera fan.  I bought these cameras for situations where I couldn't carry around my case of Nikon equipment.  I find myself wanting to carry both the HS10 and the S4000, perhaps I'll need another case for Fujifilm equipment. My Nikon camera, (D80) doesn't have a 30x zoom lens or does video, so that is another reason for using the Fujifilm cameras.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for intermediate to advanced users.
Reviews.Author: artknows
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Fujifilm S4000 after disappointment with a compact high zoom camera from Olympus (VR310).  The S4000 was a bit of an impulse buy as I had not read any reviews.  After getting it home and reading reviews, I was confused.  Some are good, others not so much.  I decided to put the camera to use and try it out.I found that the camera is very suitable for my needs.  I like to shoot snapshots of friends and family either indoors or outside.  At times, I like to shoot landscapes, sports and wildlife.  In the short time that I have owned the camera I have found it meets my needs and mostly exceeds my expectations.No camera is truly automatic and can magically create a good photograph if conditions are poor.  The same is true of this camera.  If lighting is low (dusk) and I am utilizing the zoom too much (kids in the pool 30 feet away), then chances are the result will not be a great shot (well focused, but grainy).  If the subject is too far away from the flash, again no camera can compensate for that.  Notably, this flash is pretty strong and I would rate that as a "pro" for this camera versus most point and shoot cameras.Good images are the result of good conditions and knowing your equipment.  The S4000 is very easy to use and I read the entire manual in short order and felt I was well informed.  I have taken 400 images and some have been great. I have discarded some too, but mostly because the conditions were poor; not because of the camera.I have found the camera is reasonably fast at focusing, though slower at full optical zoom.  I think that is to be expected.  It also has a reasonably short shutter lag and recovers fast enough between shots.  I utilize a Fuji 4gb SD card that I formatted in the camera.There are many many features to the camera.  Too many to list here.  It has full manual settings as well as aperture preferred or shutter preferred auto settings.  There is a complete point and shoot auto setting too.  I usually use the P setting.In short, I am happy with my purchase.  You may like this camera if you have some photography experience and are willing to read the manual to learn about the equipment.  Nice job Fuji.  For the price, it is quite amazing that the camera is packed with so many features.  AND THE ZOOM?  Simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: It's as Good as I Expected
Reviews.Author: Gerald N. Gambino "GNG"
Reviews.Content: Due to some of the negative reviews, I was reluctant to buy the S4000 camera. However, the good reviews and my previous experience with Fuji (S7000 & A600), I decided to buy it. At first, I had some of the problems as previous reviewers. After reading the manual carefully and using the Full Automatic mode with flash (for indoors), my photos became clear and bright. Unless you are skilled at using the manual modes, stick to Full Auto (Not SR Auto) and flash for most indoor photos and this camera will not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Camera!
Reviews.Author: Bill Boone
Reviews.Content: I have been around Photography about 45yrs. and have had allot of excelent equipment(Nikon)so I feel qualifyed to make these comments. I say that honestly not arrogantly. I was looking for a camera that had the capability to do what I require of it without allot of weight to carry around. I resarched this camera for two months bofore I ordered it in Dec. of last year. Whan it came I had already read the online manual from Fujifilm Global (and I highly suggest you do the same)so I knew about what to expect. So I thought! I have long been impressed with Fuji Lenses, but this camera absolutly floored me. First of all I was impressed with all the controls. This camera is loaded with all the great features I was looking for and a bunch more. This camera is as simple as you want it to be, or it can be as sophisicated as your mind can think. If you are a biginner or a pro, you will love this camera. I really like the light weight and size. It will fit in a coat pocket easily and when it is around your neck it's not a problem. I have put this camera to many tests that most people would never care about, but that's me. It passed all I put it through with streight A's. The lens on this camera will take your breath away. I tested it from the super macro through it's max telephoto and when I viewed the results I really could not believe my eyes. It was really that good. And yes, I am critical!!! When I got used to the camera (which is user friendly) and became fimilure with the controls, I was amazed at all that this race horse can do. I was really impressed with the three focus modes. They are HARD, SOFT, and STANDAD. They are refered to in the menue on the camera as "Sharpness". The "HARD", is mostly for taking shots of buildings and archecture. The "STANDARD" is for general shots that you take every day (excelent by the way) and "SOFT", which is mostly for taking portraits or shots where you might like to add a little "MOOD" to your shot. The "INSTANT FOCUS" features in this camera are really easy to use and will add to your many pleasures I assure you this camera will give you. I really, really, urge you to learn this as one of the first things you master, you will see why on your own! I have done some macro work with this camera as close as one inch from the lens while hand held, and the shots were super. (normally if you don't use a tripod these are hard to do)I would say the same for the telephoto end of this lens. Fuji outdid themselves with their "Dual Image Stabilization" system!! This camera has two fully atomatic modes where the camera dose all the thinking for you. The "Fully Automatic Mode" speaks for its self, and the results do also. The "Scene Recognition" (SR) mode will produce outstanding shots in all kinds of tough lighting shots. I use this allot if I am not sure of a scene. The "MANUAL MODE" is as good as any I have used. There are many many more features that I will not go into for times sake, but let me tell you this: "This is all the camera you need." So why not 5 STARS? I only have a few remarks, not complaints! First, I wish it had a "B" Mode, but I can do without. Also, I don't know why there is no cable release, but the self timer will work just fine. The threaded hole for the tripod is plastic. I am used to metal so I get the feeling this is a weak link. But I could be wrong, since the body is plastic, and if you research this they (Fuji) claim to have used a "High Impact" plastic. I did not test this, nor do I plan to. I'll take their word and try not to drop it. In conclusion: For the money this is much more camera than I expected. Great optics, great features, great feel, great looks, and "FABULOUS PICTURES". One last thing: Go online and search "Fujifilm Global", look for the X4000 and then download the instruction manual. The book they send you is a typical hand book. The online manual is good and is worth your time to download specially if you are new to cameras. I have shot many frames through the years, but this little camera excites me to no end!!! Happy Shooting.

Reviews.Title: Almost professional quality!
Reviews.Author: Tim D. Lewis
Reviews.Content: This camera is a good starting point for learning digital photography and the modern DSLR. It can be simple or complicated, manual or automatic. If you take the the time to read the manual (going over all the options) you will discover it is a very versatile camera. (It will train you for the more expensive options at a fraction of the cost). The quality of the photos are professional but as a professional personally I can tell the difference of expensive equipment and budget equipment. I will say that it is comparable to more expensive cameras. I considered it a good buy and worth the small cost. I recommend this camera as a good value, good quality and good for learning the ropes at a lesser cost.

Reviews.Title: very disappointed
Reviews.Author: R. Gray "Ridgetown Rick"
Reviews.Content: I too am a bit disappointed with this camera. Maybe I was expecting too much for the price. My biggest complaints are no override on the autofocus and the verrrrrrry slow response time from when you press the shutter till when it captures the image. I've had a few times where the camera just wouldn't focus on the right thing - e.g it focussed on a tree branch between me and the object and just would not focus on the object. If it's a fleeting opportunity for that special shot, it is extremely frustrating. And forget about trying to capture tricky action shots. By the time the image is captured, the action is long past. I even upgraded to an extremely fast (i.e. expensive) SDHC card because the sales clerk convinced me it was the slow write time to the other card but it barely made any difference. Apparently that was not the real problem.I do really like the ability to adjust shutter and/or aperture, and the super-macro function allows extremely close shots (a couple of cm), and the zoom and wide angle are pretty darn good. However, the panorama is just a gimmick - it works in super wide angle mode only, so your shots look distorted, and you can only capture a max of 3 images, so not a full circle. Would I buy it again? Not likely - I'd spend a bit more and get something that was faster.**This is a later addition to my above paragraphs. After less than 6 months of fairly gentle use, the icons on the selector dial are all rubbing off. When I sent it back for warranty repair I was told this was cosmetic and not covered under warranty. If it was the Finepix logo that had rubbed off, I would have said OK, but knowing what dial setting you are using is pretty important to the functioning of the camera. The poor materials used for this and the lack of support from Fuji means I will  never buy another Fuji Camera. I have a small Panasonic camera that has rattled around in knapsacks and in coat pockets with keys and change, has fallen down a mountainside and been trampled in the mud over a period of 4 years and the labels are as clear as the day I bought it! Not only that, but Panasonic has replaced under warranty things that were obviously the result of rough use (e.g. sand in the zoom mechanism, scratched lens) without a hesitation - and they paid the shipping both ways. With this new development on top of the issues I stated in my earlier review, I have downgraded my rating on this camera to a 1 star.****Final update. After visits to the place of purchase and calls to Fuji still got me no satisfaction for the premature wear on the dial, I went to Fuji's Facebook page and posted my concerns. The next day a Fuji rep contacted me and within a week I had a mail-in warranty. It's too bad I had to go that far. I am still using the camera, but I now know it's limitations and just don't expect much from it. To me, it's greatest strength is its super-macro, but I still leave the rating at 1 star.

Reviews.Title: Nothing lost in translation...
Reviews.Author: Mr. Higgle-Piggle
Reviews.Content: Approximately 28-30 years ago I had a Pentax with a super-zoom lens and all of the kit that went with many professional cameras.  After a few years I just put my camera down and didn't pick it back up.  So, 6 months ago when I wanted to get back to photography as a hobby, all that was available to my price range were the little point and shoots [which take great pics I might add], but to me, I felt like something got lost in the translation and just could not get used to holding one of those.  And then...I found the S4000. Albeit it is a point and shoot, this camera is still perfect for me.  It feels [and even looks] like a DSLR, but you don't need to be a professional to use it.  The S4000 has sooo many bells and whistles; but, not so many that you need to have a masters degree in Photography to use it :-) I's a fantastic bridge camera and really worth a look into.

Reviews.Title: A little disappointed
Reviews.Author: mbavolunteer
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth Fuji I've owned, and it's a bit of a disappointment.  I was excited byt the 720mm zzom and the 14 megapixel resolution, but wondered where they havd skimped to get the price so low.  The answer is that it's very slooooooow.  They appear to have attached the new lens to an old box with the old processor from my first Fuji 8 years ago.  When you turn it on, it takes so long to boot that you wonder if you missed the button.  The zoom is only motor driven, not manual, so that takes longer to adjust.  Then, when you push to shoot, there is a long notticieable gap before it clicks.  The previous model with only 400mm zoom was so much faster.  This new camera doesn't work well for the candid wildlife phography that I do; by the time you get it on and adjusted, the animal is long gone.Also, it does not have manual focus option, so if the auto focus can't get what you're aiming at, you're SOL.When used on a tripod for [photos you can set up or wait for, it does a nice job.  This is a camera for scenery, or for working in a blind where you can sit and wait for the animals to come to you.  Hiking around and shooting whatever you come upon is not what this camera does well.

Reviews.Title: disappointed STAY AWAY FROM FUJI
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: Have had the camera for about 2 months now trying to play with the settings.  Only outside pictures come out proper.  All the others have white lines going through the colors, looks like you printed it on a cheap printer.  It is defective.After finally getting someone on the phone at Fuji to discuss and sending them examples of the pictures they have determined it is defective and have to send it in for a "refurb" replacement.  Not happy that a 2 month old camera will be replaced with a refurb but as long as it works, maybe I will be happy.  If it is not perfect I will complain to fuji directly.After having my last camera for 8 years with no problems until it got broken by the US Air I am very disappointed that this happened and now I will nto have a new camera but a refurb.Update:  Camera is not fixable!  But my biggest complaint with fuji is that they have had my camera now since January 10th (its March 12th) and this is the first time I hear that its unfixable and they will send me a refurb if I will accept one - but noone from Fuji contacted me , I called again and wanted to know where the camera is, then I get the c/s rep who says oh yeah its not fixable so they want to know if you want a refurb.  HORRIBLE customer service! After waiting 2 months, I will not accept a refurb only a new camera or a refund at this point.  Wonder how long before the manager gets back to me.Update 2 - after Fuji sent me a "refurb" that had the exact same problem with the pictures. That went back and then was told it was not fixable again.  I called to complain again and ask for a different camera as a replacement .  I was offered a $100 credit toward another camera which started at $500.  I said no send me another "refurb" which was again garbage.  I sold it on ebay and bought another camera which I LOVE (Nikon Coolpix L810) Fuji has lost me as a customer over this.  3rd and last Fuji I will ever buy.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical at first when deciding whether or not to purchase this camera because I wasn't too sold on the FujiFilm brand.  However after using it, I can say that this is a good quality camera.  The bottom line for me is picture quality, and this delivers pretty good pictures.  I took some outside shots and they came out great.  I also took some shots inside and they came out good as well.  The key to getting the best shots out of any camera is making sure that you have proper lighting.  When I didn't have proper lighting, the shots of course came out a little grainy, however with proper lighting the indoor shots have a unique look and clarity to them that I really admire.  I try no to use the flash as much as I can because natural light and other indirect light is better but even with the flash the shots came out pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: SP Photography
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful. After reading the reviews I was a bit skeptical to begin with, however I am VERY pleased with the quality. The picture is detailed and clear. The zoom is perfect and it takes video. The video quality is nice and you can zoom in and out slowly or fast during recording time. There are many settings that I have had fun tooling with. This camera is a good starter camera for a small business.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera!!!
Reviews.Author: ligeia "ligeia"
Reviews.Content: This camera is GREAT!!!  I am not a photographer, but I feel like one when I use this camera.  It takes fantastic photos, and the zoom is great for wildlife pics, which is what I bought it for.  It takes crisp, clean photos that are so clear you feel you can reach out and touch the animal in the picture.  I have only had it about a week, and have posted photos on FB, and other public forums; I am swamped by questions about the camera; "Where did you get it?" "What kind of camera is that?"I would love to post a pic, where you could see what I mean.I am beyond pleased with my purchase, and feel I got WAY more than I paid for!  The price was great, which just adds to my satifaction.

Reviews.Title: Different than I am used to, but WOW!!
Reviews.Author: S. M. Powers
Reviews.Content: I have been shooting with Canons for many years, but when beginning her "Photojournalism" class in College, our daughter broke family tradition and got a Fujifilm Finepix 10 mp 10x zoom and I must admit I was really impressed with some of the shots she got. So I got myself a Finepix S4000 14 MP with the 30x Digital Zoom. So far I have only been shooting our Boxers at play and learning about shooting at night. It is different in how things must be done from my Canons, but this camera is not difficult to learn. The pics turn out beautifully and even at the 30x setting the pics didn't have the grainy look that most all get when shot at considerable distance. It isn't like my Canon Rebel XT, but it as close as you can get without carrying all that weight with me.

Reviews.Title: Not Too Bad...
Reviews.Author: raja_kolkata
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera 2 months back at $250. Picture quality is just average. If you compare this with similar featured Canon cameras, you WON'T be satisfied with the picture quality. BTW, I am an ameteur photographer with just 5 years of experience. I would say that it's picture quality is equivalent to my Canon Powershot A520 (4 MP) bought in the begining of 2006.Pros: -(1) Value for Money (no doubt)(2) Above average picture quality in bright sunny days and with low ISO settings(3) Zoom (can't deny...too good...only if you have very steady hands or use a tripod)(4) Movie quality at outdoors (with tripod) is above average(5) Looks & FeaturesCons: -(1) Photo Quality (purely seems like Interpolated pixels...don't know why Fuji have kept this hidden everywhere)(2) Photos are so-so on cloudy days (haven't tested any night photography yet)(3) Sound quality should have been little better.Suggestion: - Buy this camera only if you are on budget...you won't regret then. Please don't try to compare the picture quality with that of a $350 and above cameras, that would be injustice. Use tripod & self-timer for full zoom photos, you will get much better results (although its not possible to use tripods in every situation). Need a budgeted medium-rated camera, go for this, else prefer Canon, Nikon, etc. I have taken around 400 photos in diferent conditions & settings, I would conclude that only 80% were acceptable. And around 100 photos were of above average quality. I would also say that the looks of this camera (especially at full optical zoom) is almost similar to a DSLR, only this one is of a smaller size but not lighter.

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use and you get professional quality pictures!  People who have seen some of the photos I've taken say I should submit them to National Geographic.  I have won photo contests with the pictures I've taken.  I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!!  This is my 3rd Fujifilm FinePix and as soon as the overheating issues are solved with the HS20 I plan on getting one of those to step up my game.If you want a no nonsense easy to use camera that will give you fabulous pictures.... this camera is for you!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix S4000
Reviews.Author: foreign appraiser
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer. I just take occasional photos of my grandchildren and other family memmbers, friends and landscapes/monuments, etc during my trips. This camera is extremely easy to operate for a poor amateur like me while at the same time offering all sort of possibilities for more advanced photographers (even full manual operation). Furthermore, the price is unbeatablle considering all it has to offer. (I still have not tried to film with it so I don't have an opinion on this matter). BUT I have to agree with other reviewers: IT IS SLOW.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: Robert R. Salyers
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera with a lot of features and it takes good pics.No its not a 800.00 camera and should not be compared to one.I have 2 freinds who are professionals and are amazed at the pics it takes compared to its price.I was able to take some great night pics with it that looked like daylight , and some fairly good close up pics.The zoom works well and is not slow as some say.You do get what you pay for but in this case you get a lot.its a good value for someone looking for a good camera who isnt a pro and just wants some good features that are usable and who are on a budget.I will say it is plastic so dont drop it.a metal body would of been nice but it would of increased the price a lot also.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm S4000
Reviews.Author: Benjamin F. Whary "NewType"
Reviews.Content: So I worked for Best Buy for a little over 2 years, which has given me plenty of time to play with most of the electronics the day they are released onto the market everything from the Canon 7D to the Nikon 1. My favorite camera so far was the Sony CEX5 and for good reason. However never having enough money for these is a big difference.so that brings me to the point and shoots with some DSLR features. Canon has a few and Nikon as well, but most of those are looking at $400, and no BB employees do not have that great of a discount  even with some of the special offers made to employees. My attentions to the Fuji started when I noticed that all of the features of the $350-$500 cameras were being packed into $90-250 cameras.I have one of the $90 cameras(Fuji JX 310) for over a year now. So i decided to buy my wife this camera. I may have to buy 2 because we both love it. I have hypertension since deployment with the army and this camera handles my shaky hands no problem even at the 30X optical zoom. You can oversaturate you photos or undersaturate them. however you cannot add lenses to the camera like a UV or POlarizer. Still takes AA bateries which isnt a big deal if you keep a few in your pocket, or use rechargables.anyways it is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERS
Reviews.Author: Terry LeeTusing
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA IS FANTASTIC.TAKES WONDERFUL PICTURES AND THE ZOOM IS EXCELLENT.I HAVE SEVERAL CAMERAS AND THIS IS ONE OF MY FAVORITES.I DONT HAVE TO CARRY AROUND MYOTHER CAMERAS AND THE BIG LENS.THIS CAMERA DOES EVERYTHING THAT MY LARGER CAMERAS DO AS FAR AS TAKING PICTURES AND USING THE 30 X ZOOM.I AM VERY PLEASED WITH ALL THE FUNCTIONS ON MY FUJI CAMERA.I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA TO EVERYONE.

Reviews.Title: A year of steady use
Reviews.Author: PJ3
Reviews.Content: Used this little gem for about a year now.  After shooting for roughly 25 years - using multiple types and formats of cameras...I have to say - this is a nice little camera.  I can stow it in my pack's padded phone / ipod pouch & I'm done.  Even-though it's a bit bulky, I also like to keep it in a cargo pocket of jacket pocket when hiking & I am shooting a lot.I miss some features of a DSLR when using this.  But it's a trade-off.  Do I want to lug extra pounds of camera and equipment with me - or do I want to stow the S4000 and Gorillapod?  It's nice just to grab this and shoot.  After playing with it - the shots are more than acceptable.  The zoom lens equates to something in the realm of 720mm.  And it performs very well even under handheld conditions.  Bear in mind - with any zoom lens - the farther you zoom there is going to be a loss in light and a corresponding loss of image sharpness.  The zoom certainly gets softer in lower light conditions.  Have not tried the zoom beyond 70 or 80mm indoors, but from the reviews - looks like it follows suit.Learn how the various picture modes alter the image, how the camera focuses, how it sets f stop, shutter speed & you'll really get a kick out of using it.  There are also settings within the modes.  Meaning you can program the light temperature, ISO et al.  For example - trick the camera into seeing colder light so it compensates by saturating your image with richer colors as it 'warms' the image.Best results have been on sunny days.  But that's not to say I didn't get spectacular shots with cloud cover, stormy conditions and in low light.  My thinking from reading some of the negative reviews is this camera may not be for everyone.  If you enjoy photography & see taking time to learn the capabilities of a camera as a pleasure - you will probably fall in love with how simple this inexpensive little darling is.  If, on the other hand...you just like to point, shoot and move on - where learning how to get the most out of your camera is a source of frustration - this may not be the one for you.May have given this 4 stars because of simple ergonomic annoyances, but there may have been other design issues that prevented the positioning of these items.  The SD card in the battery compartment is a nuisance...as is the side facing microphone (for video).  The HDMI / A/V slots are also a nuisance on the right side.  They get in the way when connected to computer / tv.Beyond that - the viewfinder in addition to the lcd screen is HUGE for me, lcd is nice - but viewfinder is nicer when working on image composition & in bright light.  The image review, panorama, HD video, macro and zoom all do much more than I ever expected them to do in a $200ish machine.  So if you'e like me and don't like to feel as though you're outfitting for an expedition every time you head out for a hike, walk, outing, whatever...and still want a camera compact and versatile enough to take some great images - this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: You can do better
Reviews.Author: Douglas Silver "Seismic Guy"
Reviews.Content: In my SLR film days I was always partial to Canon but I have been a fan of Fuji cameras going back to their Discover line film days and also digital models.  My first serious digital was a Fuji S7000 which provided great images and was great bang-for-the-buck.  I followed that up with an S1000fd, then S9000 (my favorite), and most recently the S4000.  I did not need another camera but I was attracted by the S4000's great zoom range and appealing price.  I have to say that this is the first camera I have owned where bad images were clearly the fault of the camera and not the photographer.  I used the S4000 on a recent vacation and virtually all of the images showed some blurriness/fuzziness along the left 20% (more or less) of the image.  I later discovered that others buying this camera had similar problems (do a google search with the words S4000 and blurry).  I sent the camera to Fuji and emailed some sample images.  The claimed to have repaired the camera and sent it back but it was apparent that NOTHING was done.  I sent it a second time and they replaced the lens.  The results are now better but there is still a minor amount of fuzziness at the lower left corner of images.It has also been widely reported that the images you get sometimes have a "painted" look to them.  It is hard to explain but when you see it you know what it looks like (do a google search for the words S4000 and painted).In any event this is probably an okay camera for the price but those with a critical eye will be disappointed with the quality of the resulting images.  If I had it to do over again I would have opted to spend a bit more for the HS20 EXR model.Doug

Reviews.Title: Great Christmas Gift!
Reviews.Author: Chuwie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife as a Christmas gift. She always wants to take nature shots while we are camping but could never get close enough to really get a good picture.Although we have not had the camera but for a few days and too cold to go camping, we did take a trip through the woods and got some great shots of some geese on a pond several hundred feet away.The 30X zoom is great. I always shake too much to get good shots but the image stabilization seems to work very well at full zoom.We also used this camera for the family pictures during Christmas and the timer function is pretty cool. It actually shows the 10 second count down in the view finder. This leads me to another plus. The view finder is great when you're outside. It is often so hard to see the image on the screen because it is too bright outside and this view finder takes that problem away!One other option I found to be of interest is the option of changing the image size. You can take the normal picture at 4:3 aspect ratio or switch it to a 16:9 aspect ratio as I did when we took the family pictures at Christmas. I was able to get over 20 people in the picture and the image quality looks great!There are still a lot of different settings on the camera that we have not even touched yet.I have read other post's about the lens cap. Well it's true, if you don't remove it before you turn on the camera, it will tell you about it. It happened to me, but not much of a problem. Just turn the camera off and remove the cap.This camera is everything I (My Wife) was looking for and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Amazing clarity for the price
Reviews.Author: L. Rone
Reviews.Content: I decided to order this camera after I saw a friends.  The camera is so clear at 14MP and for the price, it is great.  My husband and I are enjoying it very much.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Finn
Reviews.Content: Got married on a budget and instead of paying >300 dollars for a photographer we bought this camera. picture quality is great, zoom is amazing, auto modes are not as user friendly as some other cameras but takes awesome pictures.

Reviews.Title: Darien
Reviews.Author: Darien
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  Took family photo 2011 Christmas, picture came out sharper with a faster setup than someone elses camera that spent $2,000+.  Obviously they used mine for the framing.

Reviews.Title: A very Good  option for the price
Reviews.Author: Shagui
Reviews.Content: Four and a Half stars due the PLASTIC CONSTRUCTIONGood camera not heavy but I think is a little too small if you have big hands and if you used to DSLR type cameras. All the body is Plastic made with rubber on the grip area, this helps you to grab very good the camera, and also you find rubber around the lens giving you more confidence when shooting photos.All the controls and features are very intuitive and easy to use and understand, the buttons are well located. It uses 4 AA batteries (included) can be Alkaline, Ni-MH or lithium, I like this because you always have the option to buy spare batteries everywhere for example, when you travel and you are in some place far away from your hotel where you supposed to leave all your stuff and you run out batteries, you can go to almost every convenience store, pharmacies etc to buy your batteries also the stores of the touristic zones the use to sale them.ProsA lot of functions that allows to shot no matter if you are new in Photo or notFace RecognitionBracketing mode up to 3 photos3" LCD DisplayEye view finder30x Zoom14 MPAA batteriesMacro and super MacroVideo HDMISDHC cardsDifferent shooting modes:Aperture priority, Shutter priority, Manual, Program, Custom, Auto, Auto with scene recognition, Panorama.ConsThe flash is not automatic you have to press the release button to use itThe tripod mount is made of plasticNo RAW option- what? Bracketing wit out it?Crappy eye view finder very small and low definitionMono microphoneIt doesn't include HDMI cable; you have to buy it apart.After all is a very good camera for the price, an excellent option for those who want a easy to use camera and still shooting good photos, not worrying about complicated menus or configurations, also you have the option to use it to learn how to use the shutter, aperture etcOne tip: Always use type 6 or higher level SDHC cards in order to have no lag of time when shooting photos or recording video

Reviews.Title: fugifilm finepix f4000 14 mp
Reviews.Author: choctaw
Reviews.Content: Just received the camera two days ago, enough time to check the functions and so far, just like advertised. Instructions-CD PDF FILE- are good. Lov the lens, for the price along with the features, it is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: It's eh.... not an SLR camera by any means
Reviews.Author: Megatronicks "Meg And Q"
Reviews.Content: So I bought this camera for the great price, the zoom, and the megapixels. I thought it would be like an SLR Cam but It's just like any ol' digital camera. It takes bad photos in low lighting even with the flash most of the time you have to have it on an EXACT setting or it won't work right. Its blurry when you focus and you think you got a great picture. It's frustrating when you do everything you can to take a good photo and it just disappoints. I've got some really great photos but only in the day outside.

Reviews.Title: Newer does'nt mean better
Reviews.Author: Not2Happy
Reviews.Content: I started purchasing Fulifilm cameras with the intent of catching my daughter on her horse doing jumps at horse shows. My first camera was the S1000. It had the multiple burst mode and it worked fine except the zoom in video mode is fixed so once you start filming you can't use the zoom anymore.Next I purchased the S2000. It has better quality all around compared to the S1000 and can snap burst photos even faster.And Fuji corrected the moving zoom so I was a happy camper. This year I tried the S4000 and was completely mystified by it's lack of all the features that my old S2000 has.The burst mode has been slowed down, and when I went to use the zoom to video,it was so fast that it destroys any attempt at a flowing zoom for a nice clean video. On top of that the zoom is so noisy it destroyed the entire video. I'd like to think that part was a malfunction,but it's on it's way back for a refund and for now I'm leaving well enough alone with the S2000.

Reviews.Title: Great bridge megazoom camera! (after using it for quite a while, it is not that great after all))
Reviews.Author: John Patrick Ryan "Jack"
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera a couple of days ago, and still learning it. Biggest reason for buying this is that I had great experience with our Fujifilm s9000. But that camera is just too big to lug around. Love the zoom! The quality of the pics are great and  my wife loves to use the panorama mode (it is much better than our S9000 when it comes to that). It is easier to use and the feel and size are just alright. But not everything is great, the camera casing is somewhat fragile, so careful with all those dropping and banging around. And just like one of the reviews here, why in the world did they put the sd card slot along with the battery slots? so if you wanna take the sd card, the batteries pop out and have to reset the dates and the like again. The box also does not provide usb cable, gotta buy your own. and lastly, it is too easy to rotate the mode dial by accident. it just rotates even if you push it lightly, thereby upsetting the mode you wanted while shooting. but all in all, it is a great camera for pros and non-pros alike...so long as you dont expect it to do what cameras that are a ton more expensive. you get what you pay for with this camera, with a few great extras...add: ive been using the camera for a couple of weeks now, i was kinda disappointed with it. its terrible indoors or when light is low. the zoom is terrible on low light. it is still great when outdoors, but once inside an auditorium with dim lights, the picture suck big time! ive tinkered with all the different functionalities, but low level light still gives it a hard time. the dial still bothers me, and the anti-shake is a joke....

Reviews.Title: Fuji FinePix S4000 is a great middle of the road camera
Reviews.Author: Runningcow
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few months ago and am pleased with the results. It is a great little camera for the price but does not replace my SLR for special trips and artsy shots. The 14 mega pixel photo size gives sharp photos, overall. (Use the largest file setting for this sharpness.)I love the 30x zoom and even took a nice photo of the moon, which even showed the craters quite well. My favorite settings are the SP "with/without flash", "super-macro", and "sunset". It also takes some nice manual shots in the M, A, and S modes. The "continuous" features are great for sports shots and active children. I also love the big handgrip, which my mom likes as well due to her arthritis.The only real drawback is the lens cap. It has to be taken off everytime you turn on the camera. If you forget, you may miss an important shot due to restarting the on/off switch. Also, I have had some trouble downloading videos. The audio does not always sinc with the video. I have a Sony Handicam for most videos but it would be nice to figure out how to rectify this situation. I need to explore it more.I gave the Fuji FinePix S4000 4 stars for being an outstanding piece of equipment at a great price!! Eventhough it is not an SLR or a camcorder, I recommend it to anyone who needs a really good middle of the road camera.

Reviews.Title: Top-Notch Product!!!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Bridge
Reviews.Content: I luv this camera!!!  I was looking for a camera with a good build quality & user-friendly features.  This camera meet & exceeded expectations...!  Awesome point & shoot with the presence and quality of high-end DSLR's...without the expensive price tag....!  This was hands-down a (No-Regrets) purchase for me...!!!

Reviews.Title: Great News Reporter Camera
Reviews.Author: Newsrocket
Reviews.Content: Any news reporter who is out covering crime, traffic accidents, fires, city council meetings, or any other news location, often can't be in the right physical position to "fill the frame" with relevant subject matter.  The Fuji FinePix s4000, with its 30x zoom, puts the reporter "in position" 95% of the time.  Low light shots require a tripod or monopod, but they are a small price to pay for coming back to their newsrooms with "THE" shot ready for print, upload or an on-air picture for internet, cable based or traditional TV format.  For slightly more than $200, this camera is a BIG value.  I wouldn't mess with anything between the s4000 and a 7D.  When you're ready, buy a 7D.

Reviews.Title: Suprised by the high quality pics!
Reviews.Author: J. Capobianco
Reviews.Content: I enjoy collecting cameras, so I couldn't pass up a deal on this one.Most of the non-DSLR cameras I have are Panasonic, so this was an opportunityto try a new brand.Despite the fact that the sensor is as small as most of my Panasonics,and that it has 14mp crammed in it(usually a recipe for image noise)Fuji clearly makes a superior sensor than Panasonic.Images taken at iso 800 are as good as panasonic cameras taken at 200.The fuji lens quality was also a big suprise, it gives the various Leica's Panasonic uses a run for their money!I tested the camera against my EOS 5D yesterday. It was CLOSE...only a very slight edge to the 12.9 mp 5D since it was very slightly cleaner of an image, and only by a little. Every thing is well thought out from High Def Video to zooming while filming. I wish the zoom was from the lens and not a p/s style power zoom but thats the only thing I would suggest, everything else is perfect.Great Job Fuji!!!Update-1/11/14 now that I have spent more time with this camera I would have to downgrade it a bit. The images have a flat appearance , they also look "painted" under enlargement and the lens is a bit soft at the edges at 24mm.3.5 stars after 1 yrUpdate-3/5/2014 I learned that if you shoot in P or Av you can switch the in camera sharpening to soft. Oddly enough, this actually makes the images look less processed and is still sharp. I also learned That zooming the camera and then zooming back to wide angle helps the optical alignment and keeps the edges sharper at 24mm. This camera blows away the Nikon L810 I just returned one.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful, sharp pictures
Reviews.Author: cruisequeen
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for a little over a month.  When I first received it, I took a few pictures around the house just to get comfortable with the camera.  I took the camera on a Caribbean Cruise two weeks ago.  It took amazing pictures.  My friends re-newed their wedding vows on Saphire Beach in St. Thomas.  The ceremony was very nice.  I took some great shots of them while saying their vows.  I set the camera to the SP scene position, "beach" scene, and the shots came out crisp and sharp.  Very nice pictures at the beach.  Earlier, I had taken pictures of the couple on the ship.  Closeups of them came out as good as a professional.  I also shot pictures under "Landscape" of beatiful tropical bays with sail boats out in the water and the shore lined with wonderful palm trees and lush greenery.  All came out crisp and sharp.  Other times when taking shots, I just left the camera set to Auto.  It took wonderful, crisp, sharp pictures.  Some years ago, I used to take photo's with an SLR which is a lot different from this camera.  I wanted something easier to handle, and where I didn't have to lug around all that equipment.  I think I found the right camera for me.  I'm still learning all it can do.  One hint.  Read the manual!!  I down-loaded the full manual and printed it out.  I'm really amazed at what this little camera can do.  So far I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the price and more!
Reviews.Author: Patricio Mena "pamv"
Reviews.Content: It would be simply unfair NOT to give this product a five-star rating. And its not only taking into account the incredibly low price. With such a price you just cant complain about the (very good) plastic case and perhaps the a-bit-less-than-ergonomic design, for example, or even the slow response of the machine in certain indoor situations. Perhaps the greatest con is that you cant fix a UV filter (to protect the lens). But all these are, at least for me, minor problems. The pros, including the price of course, exceed by far the cons. I must say that i consider myself a decent semipro photographer. I have owned fancy Nikon and Canon pro equipment, but I wanted to have a very good, not expensive, single lens camera to avoid the hassle. I tried Olympus and Lumix cameras and was quite happy with them, but for some reason wanted to try Fuji products. The price and features of this one were too good to be true, and I decided to give it a try. I am not disappointed at all. The quality of the pics themselves (both colour and focus) is better than that of any of the previous equivalent cameras. The 30x zoom is amazing and the panorama feature is very cool, as is the powerful close-up one. You can go from totally automatic to totally manual, which is very important to me. The HD video with zoom capabilities is also a plus. The AA Batteries (in my case Sony rechargeable) last a lot too. In a word, try it! Even if you really dont like it (which i really doubt), the almost ridiculously small amount of money spent will not make you angry.

Reviews.Title: Fantasic Camera
Reviews.Author: Susan M. Poor "Susan"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera!!!  Takes unabelievable pictures and movies.  I would recommend this camera to anyone... So easy to use,  great price,  great zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ashaway Sportsman
Reviews.Content: Years ago I took photography courses, had a darkroom and was all about taking pictures. Now I just wanted something to put pictures on line. This is a handful of camera, lots of features I'll never use. Most of all I like the viewfinder. It takes excellent pictures and downloading is really easy.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: 4fanman
Reviews.Content: works great unbeleivable zoom  wish I could take pictures quicker for sports but its fine. The quality of pictures is amazing  the best camera for the money

Reviews.Title: Takes excellent Pictures
Reviews.Author: Joseph T Baumgart
Reviews.Content: This camera is an excellent camera for the money. I highly recommend this camera. I prefer the viewfinder rather than the screen. The panoramic function is quite nice as well. The software if pretty basic, so you may want to invest in Adobe Photoshop.

Reviews.Title: Well, not sure really.
Reviews.Author: drsox
Reviews.Content: EDIT: December 2011 - Well, after less than 6 months the camera has gone wrong and needs repair by Fuji. The more I use the camrea the more I regret getting rid of my Minolta Z10. Not a battery issue, not an abuse issue (spent its last hours before it stopped working in a padded camera bag). Let the fun commence.I doubt I would recommend this camera to a friend.I bought it as a replacement for my 6 year old Minolta Z10 (8x zoom, 3mp) and took several comparative shots in the daytime before making the decision.The Fuji came out quite well for those shots.I have been using it quite a bit since and there are many frustrating things about it. The most frustrating for me are:*) Muddy pictures. When you zoom in on a photo (once downloaded to a computer) there appears to be a weird muddy / painted effect on most colour edges. This doesn't seem to improve even with multiple image settings, image sharpness settings etc. A photo of someone's hair (previously very defined on my Minolta) turns out very washy with the edges or hairs not defined. There are quite a few examples of this on [...]*) Noisy preview, especially in low light. The preview image displayed on the LCD has a lot of blue speckles jumping around. They don't seem evident in photos but are annoying when trying to take shots.*) Stupid location for the SD Card slot, inside the battery cover.*) Potentially worse response time after pressing the shutter button, I have yet to be in a situation to extensively test this though.There are also many good things about it:*) Easier on screen menu system than my Minolta*) Amazing and steady zoom*) Useful video format and very good quality video along with the ability to zoom during a video! (My Minolta did awful mov quicktime video).*) When you happen to get a nice picture it really is good.*) So damn cheap ;)All in all I am undecided if I am happy with my purchase, I expect I will stick with it and see what happens over the coming months.

Reviews.Title: Mixed Results
Reviews.Author: John T. Mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at the end of April 2012 in preparation for an extended vacation abroad. I have a Pentax K 110  DSLR with a Tameron 18-200mm Zoom lens which are great, but weighs too much if you carry it around all day. The S4000 is light and has many fine features. The color balance is off and to get good results I have to custom set it. The exposure, at least to my taste, is too bright outside in sunlight, and works better if reduced by 1/2 a stop with the exposure compensation feature. After figuring this out by experimentation the camera stopped working in July. I sent it to Fuji's 3rd party repair facility in Florida who did a good job, but took nearly a month to repair and return it. I like the camera, but I'm disappointed with it. I am about to leave on my trip and will take the S4000 with me, but I will also take my five year old point and shoot Cannon Power shot A540, which never gave any problems as a backup.After my own experience and reading a lot of reviews I think the  race to put the maximum pixels on small sensors has produced cameras inferior to those that only held six pixels, but produced quality up to 8 1/2 " X 11" printed images, which appears to be larger than many of the type of photographer who buy a camera like the S4000 ever print.It's now the end of October '12 and I have returned from my trip. I used the S4000 extensively and it  took great pictures but is very slow to process which caused me to miss some shots.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Eric B "Eric B"
Reviews.Content: The Fuji Finepix S4000 is a great camera especially for the price of about $200.  The 30x zoom is great.  It is at it's best outdoors of course.  I found that taking pictures using the long zoom does not work well if the subject is not lit; that is probably true for any camera.  it helps to read the manual and to take pictures playing around with the different settings.  The higher ISO settings work very well in  low light situations.  the camera does take good pictures in low light as long as it is not a far off zoom with an unlit subject.  I have been using regular AA batteries and they have worked well for the amount of pictures I take.  the video is good, but once you zoom in on the subject you are trying to video, the zoom seems to lock into a small range.  I have not figure out the aperture setting, maybe it is meaningless for this camera.  But I have found that a number of the reviews listed here that have complaints are from a lack of understanding of how to use the camera.  Maybe some of my issues are the same as well.The only thing I wish this camera could do was take raw pictures.  then you could do a lot more editing of the photos.  This is one of the main differences between this and a DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm s4000
Reviews.Author: J. Matson
Reviews.Content: Overall the Fujifilm s4000 was really good. The photos were good quality. I never really got much into the different settings but kept it on either manual or auto. The only complaint I have is that the photos aren't usually the best indoors. They tend to turn out slightly grainy if you have the blinds half closed and no lights on. Also when the lights are on sometimes they tend to have a red tint.The outdoor photos were amazing and the zoom was awesome. You could get really close to your subject without moving. The video was really good looking. The camera was really light and fit nicely to my hand.Overall I recommend getting this camera. It's exceptional  and easy to use for beginners and is NOT hard to figure out.:)Overall I recommend getting it.

Reviews.Title: SUPER AMATEUR.COM
Reviews.Author: AMEN CORNER
Reviews.Content: AS I AM TRYING TO PORTRAY, I HAVE LITTLE CLUE AS TO HOW TO OPERATE THESE MODERN CAMERAS. I USED TO HAVE AN S.L.R. 35 YEARS AGO AND I HAVE A LOT OF GOOD PIX FROM THAT. BUT I AM HAVING RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX TROUBLES WITH THIS CAMERA. WHICH BASICALLT MEANS THAT I NEED TO READ THE INSTRUCTIONS A LOT MORE.WHAT CONCERNS ME IS THAT I TRIED TO USE IT IN THE 30X ZOOM RANGE AND IT DID NOT SEEM TO GO VERY FAR. I THOUGH I READ IN THE REVIEWS THAT SUPER ZOOM COULD BRING A BOAT INTO VIEW FROM KINDA FOR OUT IN A BAY OR SOMETHING. AS IN 30X BEING AROUND 750MM. RIGHT NOW I DON'T THINK SO. BUT THIS CAMERA DOES HAVE A LOT OF FEATURES FOR THE PRICE AND AS I READ AND TAKE PIX I WILL SAY MORE. THAT'S DIMENTIA FOR YOU I'M JUST TURNING 60. AND SOMETIMES HAVE TO REMEMBER IF I TOOK MY MEDICINE.BE CONSIDERATE TO YOUR PARENTS. AAAAAMMMENNN.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera:)
Reviews.Author: Kari
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at my local shopko, and I LOVE IT. i bought it because i was going to a concert and had seats that were pretty far back and i wanted good quality pictures! let me tell you, the pictures were AMAZING. sometimes the got a little blurry because of all the vibration (the whole arena was filled with screaming teenage girls but, other than that the pictures were amazing! people commented and said stuff like "wow you guys had amazing seats so close" when in reality we were on the second level in the back, almost as far away from the stage as you could get. The day after the concert we went to Navy Pier in Chicago and a dropped my camera:( IT WAS JUST FINE! i dropped it directly on the lens and the only thing is that the outer rim of the lens (the metal part) has a scuff on it, and my lens cap is broke, but that's minor stuff, my camera still works like normal as i haven't found anything wrong with it! That happened over a month ago and i use my camera constantly.I hope this helped!  --Kari

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: This is my very first camera that I have ever owned but I can tell you that it is a great deal. I did a lot of research on the camera before I purchased it, and im glad I chose this one. I would recommend anyone looking for a good deal but also a good camera towards the fujifilm S4000. Just a wonderful camera, and it arrived even earlier than it was supposed to by a day. I will never shop ebay again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camara
Reviews.Author: Tabby White
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camara that would not only take pictures of my children for my husband to take on his upcoming deployment, but for a camara that would bring those pictures to life for him while he was gone but not break the bank.  We couldn't afford much and for the price this thing takes AWESOME pictures. When I post the pictures online for my family they all ask what kind of camara I used because the pictures are great.  I'm very very happy with this product and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Fuji s4000
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: Great, easy to use, photo's edit well.  I love it.  I used it to photo humming birds, soccer games and wildlife.  Quick focus, easy zoom...all good.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S4000
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my husband who was looking for a good value and great upgrade.  This camera fit the bill perfectly and takes GREAT pictures.  He is very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...
Reviews.Author: Zestymack
Reviews.Content: This camera works excellent, google the fuji guys, follow the instructions, contrary to popular belief it does have individual settings, I would post pics but why bother ? BUY THIS CAMERA AND A TRIPOD/MONOPOD....

Reviews.Title: Fuji S4000 Performance
Reviews.Author: Bill C. Youngquist
Reviews.Content: (The Pros) its a cheap priced camera and the blink detection works great.  85 % of pictures are in focus and are sharp with great color. The Fuji AVI Movie Format is a more friendly and easy to use then MPEG 2 or 4 or the AVCHD lite , The Camera takes 4AA batteries. The Fuji Software works with Formats AVI, also Finds and Works with  MPEG2, and MPEG4 that you may have on your Computer from other Cameras a very big plus..  (The Cons) The Camera is slow to focus indoors. The Camera has a very noisy zoom motor you can hear in the movie and the mono sound is not even close to the quality of older models ( Maybe I had a defective Camera? Did anyone else notice this?).. The Picture looks  great in optical mode Until digital is entered then it gradually gets more Grainy.. I wanted to like this camera but Im  disapponted in Fuji considering on how much I liked the S5000.  lol

Reviews.Title: Really like this camera
Reviews.Author: Melisa
Reviews.Content: This camera is working great, the pictures look so much better than my Kodak Z650.  I really like this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: IslandFireDancer
Reviews.Content: This camera is a lot better than I had expected. It's a really awesome camera which takes high quality photos. I am very impressed and glad I decided not to wait to get a more expensive camera before I was ready for one. This camera suits me just fine.

Reviews.Title: Really good camera
Reviews.Author: Belinda Short
Reviews.Content: Really good camera. Takes a bit of fiddling with to get the settings right to take decent photos but once its set up it works great.

Reviews.Title: Very slow response time.
Reviews.Author: LuvTheRing
Reviews.Content: Thought my new camera was defective.  Called Fuji support to find out it is normal to wait 2 to 4 seconds between shots!  Screen goes black for 2 seconds before you can see if you captured your subject.  Usually your subject has already moved out of the viewing area before picture is captured.  In Action mode you have to shoot way ahead of your moving subject and hope you catch them.  Still 85% of shots were out of focus.  I guess it's OK if you just shoot portraits every few minutes and your subject will sit still.  I'll take my Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ5 every time over this camera. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Natural Light Setting (SP) wonderful for indoor pics
Reviews.Author: kiltabar
Reviews.Content: This is a simple, intuitive use camera. For the money, it is very versatile, especially the telephoto / macro capability. Several reviewers complain about pics taken indoors, esp. that lag time is a problem, and that the  pics all turn out with a yellowish tint. One of the settings on the mode dial is labeled 'SP'. This setting is for 'natural light' and should be used when there is a decent amount of natural light for indoor pictures. This mode turns off the flash, and thus prevents harsh lighting problems or a yellow cast of the subject which often results from using a flash indoors. Yes, there is a lag time indoors while the camera focuses and  processes the exposure info, however, I have taken a number of shots of my cats indoors, and even when they are moving some when I  press the shutter, when the picture is actually taken the image is not blurred! This setting is also particularly useful when taking pics in museums, as many pieces of art are sensitive to the energy of photons (it degrades the paint and canvas), and in decent light you don't even need a tripod! There are some limitations with this camera: some aspects of exposure are not options in certain modes, can't attach a filter on the front, no hot shoe, no attachment on the shutter for a shutter release. But overall I have been impressed with the ease with which this camera takes telephoto pics and indoor pics without a tripod. Since there is no attachment for a mechanical shutter release, the self timer has to suffice when taking pics that might benefit from such a release, as for example a macro or extended telephoto shot. Also, there is no hot shoe for the flash, so you can't bounce the light for a softer effect, nor can you use a cord that would allow you to locate the flash off to one side, as is often useful in macro photography when highlighting depth. I cannot testify to the durability of the camera, though mine has been fine for 2 yrs.. Nor do I seem to have lens distortion on the left side of the pics, as reported by another reviewer. Moreover, the pics on the LED back are generally sharp, and produce good prints. All this from a guy who used Mamiya RB 67 (medium format camera), Nikon F2, multiple lenses, took professional photography courses at local trade school, etc...  This is actually a good camera, and would rate 5 ***** if it had a little more versatility as described above.
